Articles.Content:
<p><img src="https://31.media.tumblr.com/87dda5f22121633ebc5ff4dc817129a6/tumblr_inline_n070h9uz2Q1rr2wit.jpg"/></p>

<p><iframe frameborder="0" height="315" src="//www.youtube.com/embed/iJKladnXpUs" width="420"></iframe></p>

<p>If <strong>Scott Manley</strong> a the calm voice of wisdom, <a href="http://www.youtube.com/user/jacksepticeye"><strong>jacksepticeye</strong></a> is a punch in the face after an evening full of energy drinks. His energy and enthusiasm translates well in his <strong>Orbit Challenge</strong> series. He’s starting from the beginning and, like countless others before him, having a hard time orbiting a planet. However, <a href="http://www.youtube.com/user/jacksepticeye"><strong>jacksepticeye</strong></a> brushes off failure and potential embarrassment like a pro, making you root for him time and time again as he has fun throughout each attempt.</p>

I just wanted to say thank you for featuring my video here. I found out today from someone on Twitter that I was posted here and on Facebook. this is incredibly generous of you guys and I'm really glad you enjoyed the video enough to consider doing this, I had no idea it would happen and this is one of my proudest moments making videos. Thank you again
I need to catch a trick or two from his mad ninja commentating skillz.
Neat video... but I think it's nicer when videos with less views are featured - like this cinematic called STRANDED which seriously deserves more views than it has (it wasn't made by me).
Andrew, what I would like to know is how they fit all of those Kerbals into a command pod with only room for one Seriously thought, that was a good short film!

Someone mentioned jacksepticeye needs to tone down his profanities, but I think that just gives his videos more charm. I'm usually frustrated by people who do stupid mistakes in KSP videos, but with him cursing and being all hyped up, I was just laughing.

Neat video... but I think it's nicer when videos with less views are featured - like this cinematic called STRANDED which seriously deserves more views than it has (it wasn't made by me).

Nice to see you like the short enough to share it!

Thanks for posting this here, let's hope Squad notice it for next week!

Andrew, what I would like to know is how they fit all of those Kerbals into a command pod with only room for one Seriously thought, that was a good short film!

Well, initially I had a dialogue (just before the cinematic with the narration from Carl Sagan) that highlighted all the kerbals squashing in and complaining about the size of their helmets... but I decided to get straight to the cinematic scene while the atmosphere of "relief/rescue" was still there.
